events.originalText: The JAXA space probe Akatsuki (illustration shown) entered into orbit around Venus to study the planet's atmosphere, five years after its first attempt failed.
events.subtitle: JAXA
events.headline: JAXA space probe Akatsuki successfully enters orbit around Venus after failed attempt

events.originalText: The United States transferred its last base in the Al Anbar Governorate to the Iraqi government, ending the Anbar campaign.
events.subtitle: Al Anbar Governorate
events.headline: United States transfers last base in Al Anbar Governorate to Iraqi government, ending Anbar campaign

events.originalText: Spanish authorities captured Croatian Army general Ante Gotovina, who was wanted for war crimes committed during the Croatian War of Independence; he was eventually cleared of all charges.
events.subtitle: Croatian Army
events.headline: Spanish authorities capture Croatian Army general Ante Gotovina for war crimes

events.originalText: The Galileo spacecraft (illustration shown) arrived at Jupiter, a little more than six years after it was launched by Space Shuttle Atlantis during Mission STS-34.
events.subtitle: Galileo (spacecraft)
events.headline: Galileo spacecraft arrives at Jupiter after six-year journey

events.originalText: A 6.8 Ms earthquake struck the Spitak region of Armenia, killing at least 25,000 people (aftermath pictured).
events.subtitle: Surface-wave magnitude
events.headline: 6.8 magnitude earthquake in Spitak region of Armenia kills at least 25,000

events.originalText: The Indonesian military invaded East Timor under the pretext of anti-colonialism, beginning an occupation.
events.subtitle: Indonesian invasion of East Timor
events.headline: Indonesian military invades East Timor under anti-colonialism pretext

events.originalText: Construction workers found the remains of Martin Bormann and Ludwig Stumpfegger near Lehrter Station in Berlin, ending a decades-long search after Bormann's conviction in absentia at the Nuremberg trials.
events.subtitle: Martin Bormann
events.headline: Construction workers find remains of Martin Bormann and Ludwig Stumpfegger in Berlin

events.originalText: Australian cricketer Jack Fingleton became the first player to score centuries in four consecutive Test innings.
events.subtitle: Cricket
events.headline: Australian cricketer Jack Fingleton scores centuries in four consecutive Test innings

events.originalText: American outlaw Jesse James committed his first confirmed bank robbery in Gallatin, Missouri.
events.subtitle: Jesse James
events.headline: American outlaw Jesse James commits first confirmed bank robbery in Gallatin, Missouri

events.originalText: American Civil War: The Battle of Prairie Grove ended a Confederate attempt to regain control of northwestern Arkansas.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Battle of Prairie Grove ends Confederate attempt to regain control of northwestern Arkansas

events.originalText: British troops swiftly defeated rebels led by William Lyon Mackenzie and Anthony Van Egmond at the Battle of Montgomery's Tavern, the only major confrontation of the Upper Canada Rebellion.
events.subtitle: William Lyon Mackenzie
events.headline: British troops defeat rebels at Battle of Montgomery's Tavern in Upper Canada Rebellion

events.originalText: Suffering from mental illness, Eastern Roman emperor Justin II had his general Tiberius proclaimed Caesar, adopting him as his own son.
events.subtitle: Justin II
events.headline: Eastern Roman emperor Justin II proclaims general Tiberius as Caesar due to mental illness

events.originalText: Cicero, widely considered one of ancient Rome's greatest orators and prose stylists, was killed after having been proscribed as an enemy of the state.
events.subtitle: Cicero
events.headline: Ancient Roman orator Cicero killed after being proscribed as enemy of the state
